Among our esteemed guests of horological honor are the ever-impressive Eco-Drive watch and the budget-friendly leather strap style that’s a testament to affordability without compromise. These two remarkable watches, among others, will be our guiding stars as I navigate the constellation of Citizen’s finest offerings. I’ll be offering a glimpse into the craftsmanship, technology, and timeless design that has made the brand a true icon in the watchmaking world. Classy with state-of-the-art functionality, it feels timeless yet refreshingly modern. It’s water-resistant up to 100 meters and powered by Citizen’s sustainable Eco-Drive technology which uses light to keep it ticking. When to wear it: One of the main reasons I consider this one of the best Citizen watches for men is because it’s so versatile. You can wear it with formalwear (especially for work or weddings) but it’ll look just as good with a T-shirt and jeans when you’re heading to the bar. Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s hard to pick any faults, but the case size may be slightly too large for wrists that are particularly small or skinny. Case Size: 43mm | Movement: Quartz Eco | Thickness: 10mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel   2. Best Budget: Citizen Quartz Watch Why it’s great: Thanks to the brown croc-effect strap and gold-tone case, you could easily mistake this watch for a family heirloom. It looks like it would cost a bomb, but it’s actually the cheapest option on this list. Complete with a date indicator and powered by a Quartz movement, it’s a stylish and affordable choice for any well-dressed guy. When to wear it: You’ll want to show this off at social events, but it’ll make a lasting impression if you rock it in the office too. I find it looks particularly great worn with wardrobe staples such as an Oxford shirt, khakis, and loafers. Flaws but not dealbreakers: You can get it wet but you shouldn’t really wear it swimming or in the bath. Case Size: 42mm | Movement: Quartz | Thickness: 10.6mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel   3. Best Luxury: Citizen Eco-Drive Promaster Blue Angels Skyhawk Titanium Watch Why it’s great: Made from light but super tough titanium, this Eco-Drive Promaster looks like something you’d find in a flight deck. Funny that, as it was made as a tribute to the United States Navy’s elite flight demonstration squadron—taking inspiration from The Blue Angels’ precision and grace in the air. The ultimate traveling companion, it offers atomic timekeeping in 43 cities, plus a perpetual calendar, dual time, alarms, and a rotating slide rule bezel. It’s powered by light and secured with a fold-over clasp complete with hidden push buttons. When to wear it: Realistically, you can wear it whenever you want, but I feel it’s one for those special occasions. Or at least when you’re making an effort to dress up. Flaws but not dealbreakers: You’ll need a slightly bigger budget to afford this one (plus a decent-sized wrist). That being said, it’s still considerably cheaper than many of the other luxury watches on the market. Case Size: 45mm | Movement: Quartz Eco | Thickness: 15mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel   4. Best on Amazon: Citizen Classic Quartz Watch Why it’s great: Affordable, timeless, and versatile enough to dress up or down, this classic Citizen watch is presented in polished stainless steel with an eye-catching blue sunray dial and fold-over clasp. There’s a day/date window, while it’ll survive brief immersion in water. When to wear it: This option is the perfect addition to your smart-casual outfits, whether you’re wearing it to the office or after-work drinks. But if you want to dress it up, you can do that too. Don’t be afraid to wear it with a suit and shirt for weddings and important business events. Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s water-resistant but not suitable for swimming. Be careful if you’re taking it on holiday and don’t forget to take it off before jumping into the pool. Case Size: 40mm | Movement: Quartz | Thickness: 9mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel   5. Best Everyday: Citizen Addysen Eco-Drive Watch Why it’s great: Showcasing a silver-tone stainless steel case with a standout blue dial, the Addysen watch is the perfect everyday companion. You can wear it with pretty much anything and it’s powered by light (so never needs a new battery). Better yet, should you want to jump in the sea or paddle in the pool, it’s water-resistant up to 100 meters. When to wear it: Undoubtedly one of the best Citizen watches for men, the classic design can lend itself to formal and casual outfits alike, meaning you can wear it wherever you end up. Flaws but not dealbreakers: It barely glows in the dark, so I wouldn’t count on telling the time if you’re locked inside a cupboard. Case Size: 41mm | Movement: Quartz | Thickness: 10mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel   6. Best Dive: Citizen Promaster Dive Eco-Drive Watch Why it’s great: Ready to take you to the deepest depths (200 meters to be exact) and highest heights, the Promaster Dive watch is perfect for explorers, offering up the perfect blend of functionality, durability, and safety. As tough as it is pretty, it’s powered by the light around you and features glow in the dark hands and markers—plus an aluminum ring on the bezel and a screw-back case. When to wear it: Make sure you’re wearing it for your outdoor adventures, but you can keep it on when you head out for lunch with friends. It’ll look just as good with your hiking gear or swim shorts as it will with shirts and jeans. Flaws but not dealbreakers: With a 44mm case and 12mm thickness, this is on the large side. It may feel too big for super small wrists. Case Size: 44mm | Movement: Quartz | Thickness: 12mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel   7. Best Automatic: Citizen Promaster Sea Automatic Watch Why it’s great: This Promaster might be designed for the sea (it’ll go with you to depths of 200m), but it’ll feel just at home on land. Boasting a striking 44m case with anti-reflective sapphire crystal, it’s finished with a pufferfish-inspired serrated bezel and black polyurethane strap that makes it ideal for every day. Should you find yourself out in the dark, the luminous hands and markers ensure you’ll still be able to tell the time. When to wear it: Not just a fantastic diving partner, this watch will prove a great option for office days and weekends exploring the great outdoors. It looks best with smart-casual attire, but it won’t look out of place with a shirt and slacks. Flaws but not dealbreakers: The polyurethane strap tips it slightly towards the more casual end of the scale. It’s versatile enough to wear with casual and formalwear, but a dress watch would be better suited to tailoring. The popular watchmaker offers a wide range of timepieces, from affordable models to high-end ones. Knowing your budget will help you narrow down your options and make a more informed decision. Style Citizen sells a variety of watch styles, from classic chronographs to dive watches and dressy designs. Consider your personal style and the occasions you’ll be wearing the watch for. Think about whether you prefer a stainless steel bracelet or a leather strap and make sure the watch’s style aligns with your preferences and matches your wardrobe. Features In order to make sure you add the right timepiece to your watch wardrobe, take down notes on the sort of features you want or require. The best Citizen watches offer an assortment, including Eco-Drive technology, various complications (e.g., chronograph, date display, and alarm functions), water resistance, and luminous hands and markers. I’d like to start this article by giving props to Citizen. I’ve always seen them as a brand for the people. They’re not quite high-end (although their performance would suggest otherwise), yet they don’t try to be. They seem to be quite content in providing seriously decent watches (I’m talking vintage impressive) at an uber-affordable price point.

Which is why I thought you deserve to know exactly what the best Citizen watches are. So you can enjoy them as much as I have over the years.

Keep reading for my top seven styles that’ll improve your wrist game and have you coming back for more. Whether you’re the kind of guy who likes to follow watch trends or just appreciate the workings of a quality timepiece, good news is, there’s something for everyone.

Key Takeaways

Join me as I embark on a journey to discover the best Citizen watch for your wrist. Just kidding, I’ve already done the leg work for you by researching too many models to count. Among our esteemed guests of horological honor are the ever-impressive Eco-Drive watch and the budget-friendly leather strap style that’s a testament to affordability without compromise.

These two remarkable watches, among others, will be our guiding stars as I navigate the constellation of Citizen’s finest offerings. I’ll be offering a glimpse into the craftsmanship, technology, and timeless design that has made the brand a true icon in the watchmaking world.


In This Article

  1. Our Picks
  2. Buying Considerations
  3. Why You Should Trust Us
  4. Final Verdict
  5. FAQs

1. Best Overall: Citizen Eco-Drive Weekender Watch

Why it’s great: With its striking 43mm stainless steel case, bold black face, and three-hand dial, this classic watch has everything you need. Classy with state-of-the-art functionality, it feels timeless yet refreshingly modern. It’s water-resistant up to 100 meters and powered by Citizen’s sustainable Eco-Drive technology which uses light to keep it ticking.

When to wear it: One of the main reasons I consider this one of the best Citizen watches for men is because it’s so versatile. You can wear it with formalwear (especially for work or weddings) but it’ll look just as good with a T-shirt and jeans when you’re heading to the bar.

Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s hard to pick any faults, but the case size may be slightly too large for wrists that are particularly small or skinny.

Case Size: 43mm | Movement: Quartz Eco | Thickness: 10mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel  

2. Best Budget: Citizen Quartz Watch

Why it’s great: Thanks to the brown croc-effect strap and gold-tone case, you could easily mistake this watch for a family heirloom. It looks like it would cost a bomb, but it’s actually the cheapest option on this list. Complete with a date indicator and powered by a Quartz movement, it’s a stylish and affordable choice for any well-dressed guy.

When to wear it: You’ll want to show this off at social events, but it’ll make a lasting impression if you rock it in the office too. I find it looks particularly great worn with wardrobe staples such as an Oxford shirt, khakis, and loafers.

Flaws but not dealbreakers: You can get it wet but you shouldn’t really wear it swimming or in the bath.

Case Size: 42mm | Movement: Quartz | Thickness: 10.6mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel  

3. Best Luxury: Citizen Eco-Drive Promaster Blue Angels Skyhawk Titanium Watch

Why it’s great: Made from light but super tough titanium, this Eco-Drive Promaster looks like something you’d find in a flight deck. Funny that, as it was made as a tribute to the United States Navy’s elite flight demonstration squadron—taking inspiration from The Blue Angels’ precision and grace in the air.

The ultimate traveling companion, it offers atomic timekeeping in 43 cities, plus a perpetual calendar, dual time, alarms, and a rotating slide rule bezel. It’s powered by light and secured with a fold-over clasp complete with hidden push buttons.

When to wear it: Realistically, you can wear it whenever you want, but I feel it’s one for those special occasions. Or at least when you’re making an effort to dress up.

Flaws but not dealbreakers: You’ll need a slightly bigger budget to afford this one (plus a decent-sized wrist). That being said, it’s still considerably cheaper than many of the other luxury watches on the market.

Case Size: 45mm | Movement: Quartz Eco | Thickness: 15mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel  

4. Best on Amazon: Citizen Classic Quartz Watch

Why it’s great: Affordable, timeless, and versatile enough to dress up or down, this classic Citizen watch is presented in polished stainless steel with an eye-catching blue sunray dial and fold-over clasp. There’s a day/date window, while it’ll survive brief immersion in water.

When to wear it: This option is the perfect addition to your smart-casual outfits, whether you’re wearing it to the office or after-work drinks. But if you want to dress it up, you can do that too. Don’t be afraid to wear it with a suit and shirt for weddings and important business events.

Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s water-resistant but not suitable for swimming. Be careful if you’re taking it on holiday and don’t forget to take it off before jumping into the pool.

Case Size: 40mm | Movement: Quartz | Thickness: 9mm | Water Resistant: Yes | Material: Stainless Steel  

5. Best Everyday: Citizen Addysen Eco-Drive Watch

Why it’s great: Showcasing a silver-tone stainless steel case with a standout blue dial, the Addysen watch is the perfect everyday companion. You can wear it with pretty much anything and it’s powered by light (so never needs a new battery). Better yet, should you want to jump in the sea or paddle in the pool, it’s water-resistant up to 100 meters.

When to wear it: Undoubtedly one of the best Citizen watches for men, the classic design can lend itself to formal and casual outfits alike, meaning you can wear it wherever you end up.

Flaws but not dealbreakers: It barely glows in the dark, so I wouldn’t count on telling the time if you’re locked inside a cupboard.

Flaws but not dealbreakers: With a 44mm case and 12mm thickness, this is on the large side. It may feel too big for super small wrists.

Boasting a striking 44m case with anti-reflective sapphire crystal, it’s finished with a pufferfish-inspired serrated bezel and black polyurethane strap that makes it ideal for every day. Should you find yourself out in the dark, the luminous hands and markers ensure you’ll still be able to tell the time.

Buying Considerations for The Best Citizen Watches

Budget

Before finding the best Citizen watches, you need to establish your budget. The popular watchmaker offers a wide range of timepieces, from affordable models to high-end ones. Knowing your budget will help you narrow down your options and make a more informed decision.

Style

Citizen sells a variety of watch styles, from classic chronographs to dive watches and dressy designs. Consider your personal style and the occasions you’ll be wearing the watch for. Think about whether you prefer a stainless steel bracelet or a leather strap and make sure the watch’s style aligns with your preferences and matches your wardrobe.
